method.name: emulation_igmp_config
method.description: This procedure creates, modifies, and deletes Group Management Protocol (IGMP) host(s) for the specified HLTAPI port or handle.

description.text: IGMP Host handle if the option -mode is delete, modify, disable, enable.
Name of the igmp protocol as it should appear in the IxNetwork GUI
This option defines the action to be taken.

restriction.value: create delete modify enable disable enable_all disable_all

description.text: This argument determines if individual interface, session or router handles are returned by the current command. This applies only to the command on which it is specified. Setting this to 0 means that only NGPF-specific protocol stack handles will be returned. This will significantly decrease the size of command results and speed up script execution. The default is 0, meaning only protocol stack handles will be returned.
Enable/disable igmp host
This argument is used for Enable/Disable the igmp host item with it's corresponding item handle.
Defines the number of sessions to create on the interface. Valid for mode create.
Cofigure IGMPv3 Include Filter Mode. Valid for mode create and modify. The modification will be applied on all groups configured on the IGMP host.

choice.choiceText: The specified source(s) is (are) of interest
The specified source(s) is (are) not of interest

description.text: If true (1), respond to general queries received on the interface. Valid for mode create and modify.
Enables the Global Settings for Igmp Host.
If true (1), respond to group specific queries received on the interface. Valid for mode create and modify.
The version of IGMP to be used: v1, v2, v3. Valid for mode create.
Time in milliseconds between Join messages from clients within the same range.

A handle or list of the handles that are returned from the interface_config call. These provide a direct link to an already existing interface and supercede the use of the intf_ip_addr value.

Starting with IxNetwork 5.50 this parameter accepts handles returned by pppox_config procedure in the following format: |,-, ... The PPPoX ranges are separated from the Interface Index identifiers with the (|) character. The Interface Index identifiers are separated with comas (,). A range of Interface Index identifiers can be defined using the dash (-) character.

Ranges along with the Interface Index identifiers are grouped together in TCL Lists. The lists can contain mixed items, protocol interface handles returned by interface_config and handles returned by pppox_config along with the interface index.

Example: count 10 (10 IGMP routers). 3 pppox range handles returned by ::ixia::pppox_config. Each pppox range has 20 sessions (interfaces). If we pass interface_handle in the following format: [list $pppox_r1|1,5 $pppox_r2|1-3 $pppox_r3|1,3,5-9,13] The interfaces will be distributed to the routers in the following manner:

  • IGMP Router 1: $pppox_r1 -> interface 1
  • IGMP Router 2: $pppox_r1 -> interface 5
  • IGMP Router 3: $pppox_r2 -> interface 1
  • IGMP Router 4: $pppox_r2 -> interface 2
  • IGMP Router 5: $pppox_r2 -> interface 3
  • IGMP Router 6: $pppox_r3 -> interface 1
  • IGMP Router 7: $pppox_r3 -> interface 3
  • IGMP Router 8: $pppox_r3 -> interface 5
  • IGMP Router 9: $pppox_r3 -> interface 6
  • IGMP Router 10: $pppox_r3 -> interface 7
  • IGMP Router 11: $pppox_r3 -> interface 8
  • IGMP Router 12: $pppox_r3 -> interface 9
  • IGMP Router 13 $pppox_r3 -> interface 13

Valid for mode create.
IP address of the test interface / emulated IGMP Host. Valid for mode create.
The IP address step between each session. Valid for mode create.
The netmask length value for the interface. Valid for mode create.
If true (1), enable IP Router Alert Option. Valid for mode create and modify.
The MAC address for the interface to be created. Valid for mode create.
The incrementing step for the MAC address of the interface to be created. Valid only when using IxNetwork Tcl API. Valid for mode create.
If true (1), use -max_response_time to overwrite the value obtained from the received Query message. Valid for mode create and modify.
Set the maximum response time (in 1/10 seconds) on receipt of a query. If set to 0, immediately respond to received Query message. Valid for mode create and modify.

The number of multicast IGMP groups to be advertised during each time period. A value of 0 disables this feature and transmits all groups immediately for all updates. Valid for mode create and modify.
The interval in seconds used for throttling updates. A value of 0 will cause sending the messages as fast as possible. Valid for mode create and modify.
IP address of the neighbor. Valid for mode create.
The IP address step between each session. Valid for mode create.

If this option is enabled, the interface existence check is skipped but the list of interfaces is still created and maintained in order to keep track of existing interfaces, if required. Using this option will speed up the creation of interfaces. Valid for mode create.

If this option is enabled, the list of interfaces will not be created and maintained anymore, thus speeding up the creation of interfaces even more. Also, it will enable -override_existence_check in case it was not already enabled, because checking for interface existence becomes impossible if the the list of interfaces doesn?t exist anymore. Valid for mode create.
The port on which the session is to be created. Valid for mode create.
Clear all existent hosts. Valid for mode create.
The interval (in seconds) to wait before re-sending the host's initial report of membership in a group. If 0, do not send unsolicited report.

Enables vlan on the directly connected IGMP router interface. Valid options are: 0 - disable, 1 - enable. This option is valid only when -mode is create or -mode is modify and -handle is an IGMP router handle. This option is available only when IxNetwork tcl API is used.
VLAN ID for emulated router node. Valid for mode create.
For multiple neighbor configuration, configures the VLAN ID mode to fixed or increment. Valid for mode create.

choice.choiceText: Use the same vlan id across the ethernet items
Increment the vlan id across the ethernet items using the vlan_id_step value

description.text:
When -vlan_id_mode is set to increment, this defines the step for every VLAN. Valid for mode create.

When vlan_id_step causes the vlan_id value to exceed it's maximum value the increment will be done modulo .

Examples:

  • vlan_id = 4094; vlan_id_step = 2 -> new vlan_id value = 0
  • vlan_id = 4095; vlan_id_step = 11 -> new vlan_id value = 10
VLAN user priority assigned to emulated router node. Valid for mode create.
If selected, the emulated IGMP host automatically sends full membership messages at regular intervals, without waiting for a query message.
No. of Join/Leave messages to send per operation
DEPRECATED: use protocol_name instead
Enable IPTV
Name of NGPF element, guaranteed to be unique in Scenario
Time in milliseconds between sending a Leave for the current channel and Join for the next channel.
The maximum time that is allowed for a multicast stream to arrive for channel for which a Join has been sent.
The maximum time allowed for a multicast stream to stop for a channel for which a Leave has been sent.
Use Zap Only to change channels without viewing the channel or Zap and View to change traffic and receive traffic for the last channel.

choice.choiceText: Enables channel change without viewing the channel
Change and receive traffic for the last channel

description.text: Specifies the direction of changing channels.
Specifies the wait interval type before changing the channels.
Interval in milliseconds between channel changes based on the selected type.
Number of channels to change before stopping on a channel and watching it for View Duration.
Specifies the time in milliseconds to view the last channel.
If enabled, the timestamps for Join and Leave failures are saved to a log file.
If enabled, General Query Response is send.
If enabled, Group Specific Response is sent
If enabled, Leave for current group and join for next group gets merged in a single multicast packet

returnValue.value: A list containing the igmp host protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ethernet protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ipv4 protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox server protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the igmp host iptv protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
The handles for the IGMP Hosts created. Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
If status is failure, detailed information provided.

notes.note: If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: handle, interface_handle, iptv_handles

code_examples.example:
# Command :- ::ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_config
# This command will create an IGMP Host
set igmp_host_1_status [::ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_config \ -handle <ipv4_handle> \ -protocol_name {IGMP Host 1} \ -mode create \ -active 1 \ -filter_mode include \ -general_query 1 \ -group_query 1 \ -igmp_version v2 \ -ip_router_alert 1 \ -max_response_control 0 \ -unsolicited_report_interval 120 \ -unsolicited_response_mode 0 \ -join_leave_multiplier 1 \ -enable_iptv false \ -iptv_name {IPTV 1} \ -stb_leave_join_delay 0 \ -join_latency_threshold 5000 \ -leave_latency_threshold 5000 \ -zap_behavior zaponly \ -zap_direction up \ -zap_interval_type leavetoleave \ -zap_interval 5000 \ -num_channel_changes_before_view 5 \ -view_duration 60000 \ -log_failure_timestamps 0 \ -enable_general_query_response false \ -enable_group_specific_query_response false \ ]
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} {igmp_host_handle igmpHostHandle} # {igmp_host_iptv_handle igmpHostIptvHandle}
# This command will modify an IGMP Host
set igmp_host_1_modified [::ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_config \ -handle <igmp_host_handle> \ -mode modify \ -active 0 \ ]
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1}

# Command :- ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_config # This command will create an IGMP Host my $igmp_host_1_status = ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_config ({ handle => "<ipv4_handle>", protocol_name => "{IGMP Host", mode => "create", active => "1", filter_mode => "include", general_query => "1", group_query => "1", igmp_version => "v2", ip_router_alert => "1", max_response_control => "0", unsolicited_report_interval => "120", unsolicited_response_mode => "0", join_leave_multiplier => "1", enable_iptv => "false", iptv_name => "{IPTV 1}", stb_leave_join_delay => "0", join_latency_threshold => "5000", leave_latency_threshold => "5000", zap_behavior => "zaponly", zap_direction => "up", zap_interval_type => "leavetoleave", zap_interval => "5000", num_channel_changes_before_view => "5", view_duration => "60000", log_failure_timestamps => "0", enable_general_query_response => "false", enable_group_specific_query_response => "false", }); # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} {igmp_host_handle igmpHostHandle} # {igmp_host_iptv_handle igmpHostIptvHandle} # This command will modify an IGMP Host my $igmp_host_1_modified = ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_config ({ handle => "<igmp_host_handle>", mode => "modify", active => "0", }); # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1}
